section.title: profile.edit
section.para: profile.edit command interacts with specific profile MBean. This MBean is standard SLEE bean. It is generated based on profile specification. profile.edit allows to edit profile data(specific profile and default). Profile MBean follows state machine depicted on diagram below:

profile.edit command expects two non operation/option arguments. Form of invocation looks as follows: profile.edit <profileTableName> <profileName> <-operation[[arg] | [--option[=arg]]]*> It supports following operations:

section.title: list
section.para: list operation lists available profile attributes and information associated with each attribute. Does nor support options not arguments.

section.title: dirty
section.para: dirty operation checks if profile data has been modified and not committed yet. Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: write
section.para: write operation checks if profile is in edit mode, that is if data can be written into it. Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: edit
section.para: edit operation marks profile as editable(writeable). Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: restore
section.para: restore operation revokes all changes performed on profile and marks profile as not editable. Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: commit
section.para: commit operation commits any changes performed on profile(makes them persistent) and marks profile as not editable. Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: close
section.para: close operation deregister profile specific MBean. Does not support options nor arguments.

section.title: get
section.para: get operation operation fetches value of profile attribute. It requires attribute name as argument.

section.title: set
section.para: set operation sets profile attribute value. It does not support argument. Requires options to be present to specify name and value:

listitem.para: specifies name of attribute to be changed.
specifies value to be set in profile attribute. Supported value types are:
JSLEE types - ComponentIDs and management classes, like Address
